activities.loc: JMB Check Monitor & Posted Calendar for Courtroom

result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kaydee L Mortensen

records.addlTxt:
11:40 AM Defendant Kaydee L Mortensen appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney John Michael O'Boyle in court for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney Kaitlin Elizabeth Dippolito in court for Kaydee L Mortensen for today only. 
COVERS 22CF204, 22TR1297 & 22TR1298.
Attorney Dippolito relates.  Court resets AIA for 22CF204 before Judge Bitney and citations are to track.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for November 30, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Office of State Public Defender Appointment of Counsel Report

Defendant shall be fingerprinted at the Barron County Sheriff's Dept., if not already done.
If represented by the Public Defender and does not have a phone, must contact the Public Defender weekly at 715-908-8473.

11:19 AM Defendant Kaydee L Mortensen appeared by video.  Prosecuting attorney Brian H. Wright Aty in court for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Michael Steuer (for today only) by zoom video.

11:19  Court relates and gives appearances.
Defendant acknowledges receipt of complaint.
Court sets before Judge Bitney.
Bond set.  Must sign by 4:00 PM today.
Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for October 19, 2022 at 10:00 am.
